|| [BrainRegionMBA_HM_RF_MED MBA.HM.RF.MED] || Medullary Reticular Formation || nucleus || Somatic motor control, cardiovascular control, pain modulation, sleep and<BR>consciousness, habituation || 100 small neural networks, habituation - sleep in<BR>load city but awake from crying baby ||
|| [BrainRegionMBA_HP_BR MBA.HP.BR] || Barrington's Nucleus || nucleus || Supraspinal regulation of urination || Sends projections to Sacral Precerebellar Nucleus ||
|| [BrainRegionMBA_HP_CR MBA.HP.CR] || Cerebellum || nucleus || Motor coordination || Deep Nuclei and cerebellum cortex ||
|| [BrainRegionMBA_HP_PN_PBB MBA.HP.PN.PBB] || Pontobulbar Body || nucleus || Control voluntary muscle activities || Walking, speaking, breathing, part of<BR>corticopontocerebellar pathway ||
|| [BrainRegionMBA_HP_PN_RP MBA.HP.PN.RP] || Rostral Pontine Nucleus || nucleus || Part of learning, motivation, spatial memory pathway || Relay from mammillary body to CR ||
|| [BrainRegionMBA_MM_RD MBA.MM.RD] || Red Nucleus || nucleus || Motor coordination || Crawling of babies is controlled by RN ||
|| [BrainRegionMBA_MM_SC_DEEP MBA.MM.SC.DEEP] || Deep Superior Colliculus || nucleus || Head and eye attention to non-visual stimuli || Receive many types of input and project to numerous<BR>motor-related brain areas ||

= Citations =

{{{
- Serotonin is the neurotransmitter that triggers sleep
- Serotonin raises the threshold for pain, inhibits "arousal functions,"
  lowers blood pressure, stimulates secretion of mucus in the lungs,
  and is associated with emotional calming
- Serotonin hyperactivity results in improved appetite, weight increase, 
  an urge to sleep, dampened consciousness, slower thought processes, 
  loss of drive, decreased muscle tone, slowing of the circulation, introversion, and poor sleep 
}}}
